entry.title: Is Your Kansas City Home Susceptible to Water Damage?
entry.content:
Buying a Kansas City home? Get a full home search 
Selling your Kansas City home? Get a free Home Price Evaluation

Since spring is finally upon us, we want to take this opportunity to touch on a very important issue we often come across around this time of year.

The winter takes a toll on a lot of Kansas City homes, and as a result, people struggle to keep the exterior of their home in good enough shape to keep water out. Whether it's plumbing inside or the elements outside, water is a home's worst enemy. In order to protect your property from the various damages water can cause, there are a few things you need to look at now that spring has sprung.

The grading around your property is very important. You want one inch of fall per foot per six feet grading around your property. This way, when water hits the ground, it will run away from your foundation. If you're not careful about your grading, water could drop or crack your patio! The first two or three years that you're in a home, you're going to see some settling. If you have a home that is three years or less, add some dirt, seed, or sod around your foundation to help with drainage.

Another thing you want to do at this time is test your sump pumps and make sure they are running properly. We get about five listings a year where we have to disclose that the home has water in the basement as a result of defective sump pumps.

Every year, wood rots or moves - it's just something that happens over the course of a long Kansas City winter. Take a look at your siding and around your foundation and caulk any cracks or gaps that you find. You want to make sure everything is buttoned down tight to prevent future problems.

If you have any questions about how you can protect your home from weather damage, or if you need any real estate assistance at all, give me a call or shoot me a quick email. We always love to hear from you!

link.title: Is Your Kansas City Home Susceptible to Water Damage?

entry.title: How to Avoid a Devastating Dryer Fire
entry.content:
Buying a Kansas City home? Get a full home search 
Selling your Kansas City home? Get a free Home Price Evaluation

 Today, I want to discuss a recent tragedy and what we can learn from it. Not long ago, a home caught on fire due to the dryer vent clogging up, and the home was destroyed as a result.

I have some tips for you to keep in mind so this doesn't happen to you. If you notice that your clothes aren't getting as dry as they usually do, it's a sign that your dryer tube may be clogging up. Keep an eye on that by taking a look at it twice a year and making sure your drying machine is getting the proper ventilation. Also, current code states that plastic tubes are dangerous, and that foil tubes should be used because they are flame resistant. 

I just wanted to share this with you because this could happen to anyone. 

I also want to do a little giveaway. Robeks is a smoothie shop at 135th St. and HWY 69 in Overland Park. They have a new flavor, Cinnamon Pear, and it's absolutely fabulous. The first four people to answer the following question will get a gift card to Robeks:

entry.title: What You Don't Know About Reverse Mortgages Could Cost You
entry.content:
There are many great Kansas City area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (913) 685-2326 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Welcome back folks! Today we want to talk to you about reverse mortgages and why you should avoid them.

Reverse mortgages are generally a bad idea. They take advantage of the elderly by foreclosing as soon as someone passes, without giving payoffs to whoever is in charge of the estate. Essentially, they foreclose and take the equity of a property as soon as the owner passes away. In short, it's an ugly business.

Some lenders may tell you that's not how it happens. However, we have had clients who have personally had very bad experiences with reverse mortgages. Our advice it to STAY AWAY FROM THEM. 

If you have a loved one who is older and considering getting a reverse mortgage, let them know that there are other options, other ways to pull equity out of a home. If equity is left on the home after passing, they will try to take it on top of the large amount of fees that the reverse mortgage sets up.

We want to make sure you don't get taken advantage of. If you have any questions about this dreary topic, don't hesitate to reach out to us. We would love to advise you on your other options when financing your home!

link.title: What You Don't Know About Reverse Mortgages Could Cost You

entry.title: Now's the Time to Get Your Home Ready for Winter
entry.content:
There are many great Kansas City area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (913) 685-2326 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

The cold months are just around the corner here in Kansas City, so we have some advice on how you can protect your home from water damage. Here are 3 easy and inexpensive ways to you can do just that:
  1. Plumber's putty: Apply some plumber's putty around the area the AC pipes enter your house. Water damage can crack the seal and damage your siding - adding the putty will insulate the area and protect it. A jar of the stuff only costs a few bucks!
  2. Spigot protector: When you take the hose off your spigot, use another $2 item to protect it. It surrounds the area to keep the water from getting too cold and freezing. This is an extra step, in addition to the freeze plug, that will prevent your pipes from freezing and breaking.
  3. Gutter screens: Another cheap item you can use to protect your home is a gutter screen. They're only a dollar a piece but they'll save you a lot of trouble down the road. Jam these screens where your gutters drop to the ground to prevent leaves from getting stuck. This way, water won't overflow and run down parts of the house it's not supposed to.
To thank you for visiting our blog today, the first person to email us and let us know they intend do these 3 things will get a $20 gift card to Lowes! That should cover the cost of doing these simple tasks. The next two people to email us will get a gift card for smoothies at Robeks.

If you have any questions about or concerns with anything dealing with real estate, don't hesitate to reach out to us. We want to be your Kansas City real estate resource!

entry.title: What does Zillow's Acquisition of Trulia mean for You?
entry.content:
There are many great Kansas City area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (913) 685-2326 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions. 

An absolutely massive transaction took place recently in the real estate industry. A $3.5 billion dollar transaction, in fact. No, we aren't bragging about a deal we closed, we are talking about Zillow's acquisition of Trulia. These are 2 of the 3 biggest players in the online home search industry and 98% of buyers look at these sites first before they even contact an agent.

These sites are important, both to the consumer and the agent. We work a lot with Zillow and spend thousands on their site each month to get better online listings and to get our buyers on the site in touch with our sellers. Zillow currently receives over 80 million visitors a month , and with the acquisition of Trulia, that number is only going to increase. 

These sites are great for searching for homes online and we are proud to do business with them, but we do run into problems from time to time. One thing we don't like about Zillow is their zestimate feature. It's not very accurate and can cause a lot of headaches for buyers, sellers, and agents. When it comes to getting an accurate and true value of your home, you need to speak with a real live agent who has boots on the ground in your area. 

If you have any questions , please feel free to give us a call. We are here to help. Have a great rest of the week everyone!

Spring Cleaning: You Never Get a Second Chance at a 1st Impression

Today I wanted to talk about the importance of spring cleaning on both the inside and outside of your Kansas City home. You need to make an impact on your potential buyers as soon as they see your house, and to do this you need to spruce it up a bit.

If you look at the flower garden in this video, it needs a little touch-up, but not a whole lot because it is a rock garden. Rock is much easier to maintain than mulch, although I personally prefer the look of mulch.

Front doors are also things that might need to be paid more attention to. The door here in the video is pretty high-end, but it says a lot about the rest of the house, so you might want to consider installing a nicer front door. If you're standing outside the property waiting for the listing agent to open the door, you're going to notice the entryway while you wait, and this is your chance to impress the buyer.

Most people decide whether they like a property or not within the first 10-15 seconds of entering. You don't want to get off on the wrong foot with your customers, so pay close attention to your front entrance and the exterior.

Sometimes it's as simple as adding a few bags of mulch to an area to improve it, or repainting a front door. You'll see the examples of bad and good entryways in the video.

I want to thank you again for tuning in, and I hope that all of this information has been helpful to you. If you're looking to buy or sell real estate in Kansas City, then please do not hesitate to contact me or my team. We would be more than happy to sit down and discuss your situation.

entry.title: The Three C's of Preparing Your Home For Sale
entry.content:
Looking to buy or sell a home in Kansas City? Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (913) 685-2326 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

With spring rapidly approaching in Kansas City, I've been receiving a lot of inquiries regarding what my clients can do to get their homes ready for sale. While every realtor will suggest different things, there are a few that you absolutely must do to prepare your home for sale. These are just a few of the necessary steps you should take to prepare your home.

1. Countertops: Clear off these spaces. Remove appliances from them and also clean them. You want to make it appear as if you do not live in the property. Let the buyer imagine what they might put on your counters.

2. Closets: This advice goes for these spaces too. Clean out your closets as best as you can. You want to show as much carpet as possible. The more empty a closet is, the larger it appears to be. Even if you have a smaller home with smaller closets, if you empty them out it can instantly make a potential buyer think that your home is larger. Empty space is your friend.

3. Carpet: The more carpet you have showing, the better. Clear away couches and recliners, or do whatever is necessary to free up carpet space. Removing the furnishings and displaying your flooring will make your home appear larger and much nicer.

These are just a few simple ways that you can prepare your home for sale. Overall, you want to emphasize empty space and aim for neutrality. You have to let the buyer imagine themselves living in your home, and the best way to do that is to declutter, clean, and neutralize your home of unnecessary items.

If you want a full explanation for your specific property, just contact me and I would be glad to give you a more detailed list of ways to prepare for a sale. There are many different things to consider, and the list above is only a small fraction. However, expect a very busy spring and summer market here in Kansas City, so start making these preparations as soon as possible.

Also, if you need assistance either buying or selling real estate in Kansas City, please contact me. You can reach me by phone at (913) 685-2326 or contact me via email at adam@adambutlerteam.com

link.title: The Three C's of Preparing Your Home For Sale

Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call us at (913) 685-2326 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions. 

Hello and welcome to my new video blog where I'll be updating you every two weeks on how the market in Kansas City is doing. Aside from these updates, I want to educate and inform you on various aspects of the real estate market in order for you to succeed in all your financial endeavors. Allow me to be your resource for real estate.

What We Might See in 2014

  • Sales prices are up 6.5% from last year, which is a good sign for this year.
  • Sales volume is the same, but inventory is down, which might explain the rise in sales prices.
  • Interest rates are expected to stay the same, which could drive sales prices up another 5-7%.
If you're thinking about doing something with real estate, this spring would be a good time to make that choice. Feel free to contact us because we would love to help you in any way.

You can reach me at (913) 685-2326 or send me an email at adam@adambutlerteam.com

Thanks for tuning in, I'll see you next time!
